thread.title: DI Sleet and his celebrity sleuths to return for more Murder In Successville
thread.title_full: DI Sleet and his celebrity sleuths to return for more Murder In Successville

title: DI Sleet and his celebrity sleuths to return for more Murder In Successville
text:
DI Sleet and his celebrity sleuths to return for more Murder In Successville DI Sleet and his celebrity sleuths to return for more Murder In Successville Share 
Murder In Successville is to return to BBC Three for a new series. 
Tom Davis will return as DI Sleet in the surreal Tiger Aspect comedy, which pairs the detective with a celebrity sidekick who must help him solve a murder in the fictional town. 
In series one Dermot O’Leary, Louis Smith, Jamie Laing, Deborah Meaden, Kimberly Wyatt and Greg James signed up for the challenge, which saw them dropped into Successville where they attempted to get to the bottom of the latest crime. 
In the new series, prepare to see some well-known faces, impersonated by the likes of Tom Stourton, Colin Hoult and Cariad Lloyd, as you’ve never seen them before, and expect DI Sleet to put his famous rookie sleuths in more ridiculous and hilarious predicaments. 
Tom Davis said of his return: “I’m over the moon to be heading back to Successville and I would like to thank the BBC for embracing the madness of the show. We have loads more mad places to go and I can’t wait to see who we are taking there. Let’s go solve a crime.” Who'd be the dream rookies for series two? #murderinsuccessville @bbcthree @TigerAspectUK 
— Tom Davis (@BigTomD) October 14, 2015 
Damian Kavanagh, controller of BBC Three said: “BBC Three will always be home to the best British creative ideas and talent and Murder In Successville is no exception. The guys were amazing in the first series and I am sure we will have celebs knocking down our door to get under DI Sleet this time.” Share article 
The series will be directed by James de Frond and starts shooting in January 2016, transmitting later in the year. Promoted Stories
